messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 30-39 years old, male, of White descent. You have a graduate or professional degree and an annual income of $55,000 - $74,999. English is your first language. You are 0 feet tall and weighs <125 lbs pounds.You are someone who takes a moderate number of prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You have a moderate weekly physical activity. You are someone who I agree with my thinking style. I am unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings rarely. I agree that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts never. I strongly agree that my well-being is good. I strongly agree that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I strongly agree that I am dependable and organized. I unknown that I am emotionally stable and calm. I unknown that I am open to experience and imaginative.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
to a very high degree, i am educated enough to understand them. besides i ask my doctor to tell me every single detail so i would be able to understand the whole situation.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
of course i trust my doctor i have chosen him  because of his good fame and he always give me the right treatment.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
nothing at all, i am always relaxed , there is nothing to be afraid of, besides i trust my doctor very much.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
it is a high level experience, i have a good knowledge, i know who is the best doctor to see when i am sick.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 18-29 years old, male, of White descent. You have some college education and an annual income of $75,000 - $89,999. English is your first language. You are 2 feet tall and weighs >200 lbs pounds.You are someone who takes few or no prescription drugs regularly, has a primary care physician, and occasionally visits them. You engage in little physical activity weekly. You are someone who I agree with my thinking style. I am unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings sometimes. Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I think I have the ability to make my own health decisions because I am very smart. I can process information then make a decision.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
He's just a regular doctor, maybe he's trying to sell me something for all I know. That's what some doctors do a lot.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I just get anxious since I'm not in good shape and something could go wrong. I would feel embarassed making myself sick for no reason.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I experienced knowledge of health issues by reading mom's health records/etc. while in the hospital and helping her understand it. It made me feel like I was being useful.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I understand all the forms that I am given t read and fill out , I speak , read and write  English quite well
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
has always been to the point and forth rite in dealing with me in all of my health concerns even now that I have a rare terminal condition
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
where might my blood pressure be. I do have some white coat tension when they measure that the first time but then when they measure it a few minutes later it is much better
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

over the last seventeen years of being treated for CHF and Arterial Stenosis , have had many experimental medications and other treatments. so far after being diagnosed with a 3 to 5 year life span with this condition have now survived 17 years

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I think i can deal with basic health info just fine. I figure I can do my own taxes by hand and file bankruptcy myself then I should be smart enough it understand medical information.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I think that these days that doctors are trying to push more and more drugs that half the time you dont need. That is pretty scary to think about. Also treatment varies greatly from doc to doc even on simple things like a infection. So there are times i cant trust the doc 100%
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I dont get anxious, hes doing his job and will tell me what he thinks. Yeah there could be bad answers like i got cancer or something but for the most part its not that heavy
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I am able to understand 95% of the terms a doc uses so overall I am no slouch on medical information. The doc doesnt have to dumb down the results for me to understand which surprises a lot of docs.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I think that I have good knowledge but thankfully I have never been in a health situation except when I had my two children.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
She listens to me, repeats back to me my concerns and has given me no reason not to trust her. She takes the time necessary to understand my needs and questions
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

Sometimes health issues come out of seemingly nowhere and even though I try to live as healthy as I can, I am concerned that I might have a condition. Family history tells me I could get certain health conditions.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I went to college for four years to become a Medical Laboratory Scientist. It eqipped me to know a fair amount about disease and health conditions. Though I am not always the best with math word problems.

Totally confident that I am able to understand doctor's instructions, explanations, reasoning and procedures about what is wrong with me and the procedure they are going to take to repair the issues.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I have been with the same doctor for 3 years and she actually listen to what I have to say and offers her best remedy and prescriptions to fix what is wrong or needs repaired.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
nothing make me most anxious or worried when I visit the doctor's office.  I go to get well and the doctor is the person the I respect and seek answers.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I have knowledge of heath and appreciate a doctor's input on correcting the problems and issue to make my health better.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I can see and read perfectly fine. I don't like it when the Dr. doesn't give you time to respond to any concern that have arisen while he is talking to you. I almost always feel rushed. And uncertain what was even said. I have had so many come in and start going on about what needs to happen or what is going on right away. They don't give you time to process anything. You might have a question early on and the not hear anything said after that. Or else completely forget the question you had trying to comprehend what is being said.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

They get in to mush of a hurry, it feels rushed. They will come in and start discussing what needs to be done and while I'm there I feel like I don't even talk the same language sometimes. I almost always look everything I can remember on line. It helps me figure out what is really going on.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I have a hard time comprehending people talking at me. I can't focus no matter how hard I try. I usually try remember key words and look up stuff later. They just get so rushed I don't want to be rude and keep interrupting. So I feel useless sometimes. And passed off that after 35 years of the pain no has an explanation.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have had unknown leg pain most of my life. I injured my back quite a few years ago, and I  have worked in a hospital a few years ago. I have take medical terminology classes. Biology classes. As well as as a few other classes to be a Naturopathic Practitioner.  I have yet to take the Anatomy classes.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel I am able to make appropriate health decisions - I ask a lot of questions and if unsure I will look it up online to make an intelligent decision
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I will go to the doctor if something is wrong and so far have never been sent wrong or given wrong advice or information
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Nothing really makes me feel anxious at all when I go to the doctor suprisingly I have always had good checkups and no major health issues.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

An instance in my life that demonstrated medical issues is when i was pregnant and put on bedrest  I was very aware of how to act, what to do and not to do.  I was able to carry to full term when only given a 30% chance of it

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I lack confidence when trying to process information related to health and wellness. I find that the words and techniques are in a language that only people in the medical field can understand fully. There is a lot of technical jargon contained in the materials that average people usually cannot understand. I usually have to rely on speaking directly to my doctor or nurse to make sure that I understand what is being said. There are only a few websites that are dedicated to explaining medical terminology and even these can be complicated to understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I have a lot of trust in my primary care physician. I have been with this same doctor since I was a child and he has been very courteous and helpful with my medical needs. My doctor is located in a small facility so there are not that many patients he sees in a day. The care is very personal and positive. He has a way of talking to people that is very relaxing and comforting to everyone he sees. There has never been a time that I have doubted the advice or treatment he has given me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I would feel anxious or worried about a doctors visit if I had a strange pain or feeling in my body that I haven't had before. Not knowing what could be the cause of the pain or illness would make me worried about what the diagnosis could be. I would slightly doubt the doctor fully understands what I am feeling and if the treatment would be the correct procedure for me. I would not feel anxious or worried if I was just going in for a regular checkup or follow up. Only when I am experiencing something I have never experienced is when I would start to worry.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

A few years ago I had a friend that was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer and she was admitted into a cancer treatment center. She was very worried about what kind of processes and procedures she would go through. I was able to talk to her about what she may experience because my father was also diagnosed with cancer and I watched him suffer through it for 6 months going through all sorts of different treatments. Because of my experience with my father I was able to talk to my friend about what she can expect and how hard the process is going to be.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I like that the dr takes the time to listen and make sure to understand what is going on and to make me feel like a person that can get better and do well.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I do not like to wait for test results to say what is going on with my overall health I like to know right away what is happening and going on .
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I tried to use my math skills the best that I felt that I could to try and figure out the information presented.

I can do this at a fairly high level.I was an honor graduate of college and went to grad school.My wife is a nurse and my dtr is a Nurse Practitioner so I familiar with medical jargon
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
my dr is conservative-He does not jump to meds etc That approach is equal to mine so we are on teh same page  He is a caring man also
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Afraid he might discover I have a serious condition such as cancer-I had prostate cancer-now zapped and cured
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My doctor has told me many times that I  live a healthy lifestyle He says I know what to eat and how important exercise is as well as a positive mental attitude

Confident to the point that I do not need additional help. Still working part-time as well. Vacations are taken through out the year as well.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
The doctor appears to be well informed and caring in regards to the patients that are scene. There are times when they appear to be rushed though.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Not your normal surroundings and are taken out of your comfort zone. Hoping the results will be good.

Being a good listener. Read medical material. Try and stay up to date as much as possible. Talk to others on various subjects.

i think i am about average, i have had some but limited experience
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
my doctor misdiagnosed my low sodium
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
finding out something bad
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I had a two day stay at the hospital. I was treated for low sodium,because of a drug interaction. I had to answer a lot of questions and i learned a lot.

i feel very confident that i can understand any information that is given to me by my medical team.  any medical term that i do not understand i can ask them to explain and when i get time i can look it up on the internet
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
i trust my primary care physician for their knowledge of medicine.  but you have to ask question about your illness and the treatment you are being asked to undertake
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
i am already dealing with a few health issues myself.  so when i go to the doctor i am expecting unpleasant news.  it is like you found this last time now lets see what else we can find.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
i have not had any particular medical issues that i would have to show any medical knowledge of anything.  i have enough common sense to research and check on the latest data

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I usually have no problem understanding common terms but there are sometimes foreign concepts that need explaining. Usually, the staff at hand answers all of my questions in a satisfactory manner.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

most doctors that I've had has had the patients best interest in mind. Sometimes they may not seem too warm or attentive but most of the time they are in my experience. They make sure to go over everything thoroughly so they don't miss any symptoms I might be having and that I understand fully the information that they need to tell me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
usually what they may or may not find. You never know what problems you could have until you get an examition. I usually trust their skills and judgment and that they'll do their job well though.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I don't know much about the medical issues I have before I'm dealing with them in the hospital. I've had an infected foot that I didn't know how to treat or take care of and it got out of hand and landed me in the hospital.

In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was diagnosed with epilepsy in 2011. I've endured five surgeries in 2001. Leaving me with menopause, limited mobility in certain life duties. Such as doing stressful, heavy weight work. Which in my mind I will but my body gives out. Hypertension makes the depression kick in. They give me pills for seizures and pain. However I can't afford them so I get generic and that does nothing. So when the pain is past 10 to the ER I go. I'm thankful I'm aware, but the prolonged pain while there is awful.
